2164.subject: GS
2164.descrlong: Covers basic micro and macroeconomic principles in relation to policies and real-world case studies from gender, ethical, and global perspectives.  Students learn key economic concepts that affect their lives, along with the social/cultural contexts of major economic thinkers who coined those economic principles. It presents social scientific methods of inquiry in multiple social science lenses. Students learn feminist, environmental, and Global South perspectives.
